searchDocs.title: Version 1.0.0​
searchDocs.content: Chickenbot release 1.0.0

searchDocs.title: Description​
searchDocs.content: Version 1.0.0 is the very first public version of ChickenBot!  ChickenBot is a standalone Windows Desktop application that allows you to start an automated Minecraft player: We are talking about a ’bot’ here, or ’robot’ in French.  The main goal of this application is to allow a wide audience to easily create fun Minecraft bots.  In this initial version you can configure the bot with one or more functions:  ’welcome’ function (max: 1): indicate the chat that the bot pronounces when it appears (or reappears),’reply’ function (1 or more) one or more questions/answers: the bot detects a particular chat and responds with a particular chat,’follow-me’ function (max: 1) ask your bot to follow you, or to stop following you.  This is a Freemium application. Version 1.0.0 is 100% free. It is possible that in future versions, some (new future) functions will be paid.  Finally, here are some technical details and conditions of use.  The interactions between the application and the outside are as follows:  depending on the configuration of the robot(s), exchanges with the Minecraft server(s) to control their connection/actions,sending anonymized statistics of the application’s use to a Umami Cloud instance.  Using the ChickenBot application means accepting these conditions of use and therefore the sending of anonymized statistics. In transparency, the installation guide shows how to activate the debug and trace these calls. The anonymized statistics are used to better understand the uses of the application, and to improve future versions.

searchDocs.title: Applicative logs​
searchDocs.content: Application logs are located into C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Roaming\<appName>\logs.

searchDocs.title: Activate debug logs​
searchDocs.content: In order to augment logs with debug applicative logs : update CHICKEN_BOT_VERBOSE environment variable  set CHICKEN_BOT_VERBOSE=true # or export CHICKEN_BOT_VERBOSE=true

searchDocs.title: Activate analytics logs​
searchDocs.content: In order to augment logs with analytics logs : set CHICKEN_BOT_VERBOSE_ANALYTICS environment variable to true.

searchDocs.title: Activate more error logs​
searchDocs.content: In order to augment error logs, add --trace-warnings to the start command.

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Welcome Start by reading bot setup. Then continue by reading bot user guide.

searchDocs.title: Download the application​
searchDocs.content: Go to the home page of this website to download last version of the chicken-bot.  ➡️ https://chickarmy.github.io/chickenbot-web/

searchDocs.title: First start of the Chicken-bot​
searchDocs.content: Once the executable file is located on your workstation, start it !   chicken-bot.exe   ➡️ cf. Notice about performances➡️ cf. Notice about security  A desktop application popup must appears. You're in !  Continue by reading bot user guide.  To get more advanced tips about setup, cf. this page.

searchDocs.title: Notice about performances​
searchDocs.content: This application is an ElectronJS desktop application that embeds Chromium browser and could takes so much time to appears especially the first time. Be patient.

searchDocs.title: Notice about general security​
searchDocs.content: As this application is an executable you must be warn of this commons rules:  you must always retrieve official binaries from official websites. For chicken-bot, the official resource is chickenbot-web/release : https://github.com/chickarmy/chickenbot-web/releases. This resource site is used by official website.you must always double-check binary BEFORE executing them from your local anti-virus / anti-malware application and trusted on-line services. One good way to do that is to drop any downloaded files onto https://virustotal.com website and wait for full analysis from different security providers.➡️ You may notice that chicken-bot exe produces a false positive from Bkav pro security provider (cf. ticket #49).

searchDocs.title: Notice about MS Windows security​
searchDocs.content: As chicken-bot executable is NOT coming from Microsoft trusted source, Windows will produce some popup to warn you. You must accept them in order to launch app.    ➡️ click on "Informations complémentaires"    ➡️ click on "Exécuter quand même" (only when you're confident regarding security analysis).

searchDocs.title: Your first Minecraft bot !​
searchDocs.content: start the application.Click on "Add a bot" button.    Define you bot configuration (server, username, functions)

searchDocs.title: Server configuration​
searchDocs.content: online server  You will have to setup the target minecraft server (hostname + port). In this example pouletrempee.aternos.me:62548 is used as Server host:port. It's an online minecraft server provided by Aternos.  local server  You could rely on a local minecraft server. In this case, your local server must be visible from network. For example by using this command :/publish true adventure 25565    In this example localhost:25565 must be used as Server host:port.  bot username  Finally choose a bot username. This username is used as server player name.  In this example chickenNuggets will be used as player name.

searchDocs.title: Functions configuration​
searchDocs.content: Choose at least one function for your bot.  You could  click on Add a functionselect a function called Welcome    this function definition screen shows the behavior to set for your bot. some text could be customized. In this example, you can set the message that the bot will say on spawn. click on Add click on Save : to record your bot definition (server host:port, username, 1 function).

searchDocs.title: Lets run the bot​
searchDocs.content: From home page, select the bot you've just created  Click on Start to activate the bot.    Let's play now!
